titles.title: Military Parole Limitation Act of 1998

To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide that a person sentenced by a court-martial to confinement for life may not be granted parole until the person has been confined for at least 30 years.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on National Security.

bill.summary: 5/20/1998--Introduced. Military Parole Limitation Act of 1998 - Amends provisions concerning military correctional facilities to prohibit an offender serving a sentence of confinement for life from being granted parole before the completion of at least 30 years of such confinement.
